title: Inside Britain's Beach Hut of the Year (and it's a quick tour): Shabby-chic shack in Essex called 'Betty' awarded the top prize by Phil Spencer
text:
View
comments
An Essex beach hut called 'Betty', praised for its retro aesthetic, has been declared the best in Britain.
Location Location Location's Phil Spencer awarded Jane Ashmore's Mersea Island hut the coveted Towergate Beach Hut of the Year.
As one of 11 finalists, Betty was selected, after a week-long public vote, for its aesthetic creativity, unique style, and the charitable role it plays within the local community.
Jane Ashmore's Mersea Island beach hut, in Essex, has been named Towergate Beach Hut of the Year
The hut, which has been nicknamed 'Betty,' was praised for its creative aesthetic and shabby-chic decor
The judging panel, which included Mr Spencer, was unanimous in its decision.
Situated on Victoria Esplanade in Essex, the family hut, which was once used by Jane's children, is now often let out for new families to enjoy.
Betty has been styled with a shabby-chic retro interior, complete with items exclusively sourced from local charity shops.

Domino's pizza delivered by PLANE to... The judges praised Betty's authentic origins, as well as its charming, quirky decor.
A local favourite, Jane also lets the hut out to a number of community charities free of charge and regularly gives vouchers to Great Ormond Street Hospital to be auctioned - usually raising £350 or more.
Location Location Location's Phil Spencer, who was one of the expert judges during the competition, presented Jane with her award (left)
'It was an immensely difficult decision to select this year's winner among the incredible array of entries and fantastic designs,' Phil Spencer explained in a statement.
'However, 'Betty' was chosen for its beautiful decor and its admirable contribution to the local community which made it a stand out hut for us.'
As well as receiving the illustrious title of Beach Hut of the Year, Jane also won £1,000 for West Mersea Beach Hut Association, a year's free beach hut insurance and a commemorative plaque.
'Betty' was one of 11 finalists, which also included this This Cath Kidston-styled hut from Southcliff Parade, Essex
‘The Little Beach Hut of Dreams’ is a cosy spot with uninterrupted views at King’s Esplanade, Hove Read (left), while another finalist hut (right), works with MacMillan Charity, including tennis player Greg Rusedski
'I am genuinely shocked that 'Betty' has scooped top prize!' Jane said.
'It's a wonderful acknowledgement of how much work I've put into Betty and it's heart-warming to see that people love Betty as much as I do.
'It is also a clear sign that beach huts are an up and coming trend and I believe it's because it reminds us of a simpler way of life which is a far cry away from the manic lives we lead now.
'I really am over the moon and far away on learning that we have won '.
